itemselectr 0.1
  • Reference

McDonald's item information statistic

item.information.Rd

Calculates item information statistics (McDonald, 1999).

Usage

item.information(x)

Arguments

x

A data frame containing items

Value

A matrix containing for each item its (a) unstandardized factor loading, (b) square of the loading, (c) unique variance, and (d) item information.

Examples

info <- item.information(work_stress[1:9])
#> $`Item information statistic`
#>  GWS1  GWS2  GWS3  GWS4  GWS5  GWS6  GWS7  GWS8  GWS9 
#> 1.346 1.262 1.366 1.262 1.250 1.239 1.218 1.275 1.113 
#> 
#> $`Item information statistic sorted`
#>  GWS9  GWS7  GWS6  GWS5  GWS4  GWS2  GWS8  GWS1  GWS3 
#> 1.113 1.218 1.239 1.250 1.262 1.262 1.275 1.346 1.366 
#> 
#> $`Item information`
#>      Loadings Loadings_squared Uniquenesses Information
#> GWS1    0.810            0.656        0.488       1.346
#> GWS2    0.849            0.721        0.571       1.262
#> GWS3    0.792            0.627        0.459       1.366
#> GWS4    0.803            0.644        0.511       1.262
#> GWS5    0.691            0.478        0.382       1.250
#> GWS6    0.675            0.456        0.368       1.239
#> GWS7    0.762            0.580        0.476       1.218
#> GWS8    0.681            0.463        0.363       1.275
#> GWS9    0.693            0.480        0.431       1.113
#> 
#> $`Item information sorted`
#>      Loadings Loadings_squared Uniquenesses Information
#> GWS9    0.693            0.480        0.431       1.113
#> GWS7    0.762            0.580        0.476       1.218
#> GWS6    0.675            0.456        0.368       1.239
#> GWS5    0.691            0.478        0.382       1.250
#> GWS4    0.803            0.644        0.511       1.262
#> GWS2    0.849            0.721        0.571       1.262
#> GWS8    0.681            0.463        0.363       1.275
#> GWS1    0.810            0.656        0.488       1.346
#> GWS3    0.792            0.627        0.459       1.366
#>
